required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preoperative Vaginal Dinoprostone Prior to Abdominal Myomectomy
clinical_study.official_title: the Effectiveness of Preoperative Vaginal Dinoprostone in Reducing Blood Loss During Abdominal Myomectomy:a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to compare the effectiveness of vaginal dinoprostone 3 mg versus placebo before myomectomy to decrease blood loss during and after the operation.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean amount of intraoperative blood loss
primary_outcome.description: Mean amount of intraoperative blood loss in ml

arm_group.description: patients will take 1 tablet of vaginal dinoprostone 1 hour before the surgery
patients will take 1 tablet of placebo 1 hour before the surgery

intervention.description: the patient will take one vaginal tablet of 3 mg dinoprostone 1 hour before surgery
the patient will take one vaginal tablet of placebo 1 hour before surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- • Patients presenting for abdominal myomectomy with documented uterine fibroids on pelvic imaging
- Age ≥ 18 years and ≤ 50 years
- Pre-operative hemoglobin >8 g/dl
- Ability to understand and the willingness to sign a written informed consent.
- Admissible medical/surgical history
- Five or less symptomatic uterine myomas
- All myomas are subserous or intramural.
- Uterine size less than 24 weeks pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- • Patients who have had a prior abdominal myomectomy
- Post-menopausal women
- Patients with known bleeding/clotting disorders
- Patients with a history of gynecologic malignancy
- Hypertension.
- Cardiac and Pulmonary diseases.
- Obesity (body mass index > 30 kg/m2).
- History of allergic reactions attributed to misoprostol
- Cases that will require intraoperative conversion of myomectomy to hysterectomy.
